div.head: Elizabeth Lilly. Will.
div.p:
In the name of God Amen. The 15th day of November 1676. in
the 28th of the Reigne &c I Elizabeth Lilly of Charles County in the pronvince of
maryland sick of body but of sound and perfect memory praise be given to god
for the fame and knowing the uncertainty of this life on earth and being
desirous to settle things in order do make this my last will and testament
in manner and form following viz. First and princpally I commend my soule
to God Almighty my Creator and afoundly believing that I shall receive full
pardon and of my sins and be saved by the merits and
Death of my beloved Savior and redeemer Jesus Christ and my body to the
earth from where it were taken to be buried in decent Christian manner
and as touching such worldly good, as the Lord in merry hath sent me my will
and meaning is that it be bestowed as hereafter by this my will is
First I doe revoke and make said all former wills by me made & declare &
appoint this my last will and testament

List
Item I will that all those Debts that I have of right or conceince to any manner of person
shall be well and truly paid in convenient time after my decease by my Executor
beneath named.

Item I give and bequeath to my lo. father in law Peter Carr all & all manner of Estate
virg. Lands chattles moveables & Immoveables whatsoever to him and his heirs forever

Item I nominate and appoint my aforesaid father in law Peter Carr my whole and
Sole executor In testimony whereof I have hereunto set my hand and seal
the day and year above.

Signed Sealed & Deliv. as my last will
& Testimony in the presents of us
Anthony Bridges.- Joseph B
sign
Elizabeth Lilly

On the back of the aforegoing was enforsed the following probit (to will)
December 30th 1676 By virtue of a commision from the Judge for Probate of
C. Mills &c. dated the 30th day of November 1676 to me discreeted and I called before me
Joseph Bullettt one of the witnesses to the within written will who on the day above
written by his oath proved the within written will Anthony Bredges the other witness
in Virginia I could not call before me
4 sides
Benjamin Rogers
